poem:
Polls in the City   

Amid skyscrapers, numbers rise—  
Mamdani, a new dawn's hue,  
19 points above the old,  
whispers stir in concrete veins.  
Cuomo, a shadow cast long,  
yet in the city's breath,  
change rustles—  
leaves in autumn air,  
a hopeful city's pulse—  
echoes of tomorrow.
